First participants draft baseball players for their teams from the available players. The players are color coded with gold being the best, blue the next best, and then red. These are considered All Star players in the league. Any position that is not filled is considered to be a regular player. After teams are drafted then games are played.

Each game is only 1/2 an inning. It is considered to be the critical 1/2 inning of the game where the game is won or lost. First a lead is determined for the pitching team of 0-4 runs. Dice are rolled for each batter and charts are referred to for results until three outs are recorded(the pitching team wins) or the batting team takes the lead(the batting team wins). The first team to win 20 games wins the pennant.

boardgameimplementation: Die Siedler von Catan: Das Würfelspiel – XXL-Ausgabe
27710.description:
Like all the other games of the "Settlers of Catan" series, this game is about building settlements, roads, cities and hiring knights. This time, there is no board on which to place little figures: Every player has his own score card called the building sheet, which depicts a mini Catan (compare with Die Siedler von Catan: Paper & Pencil). You build by drawing the settlements and roads on your score card.

To build you still require resources. These are collected by a Yahtzee-like mechanism that involves throwing six special dice (depicting the different resource symbols) up to three times. After each roll, the player can select which dice to keep and which to roll again. In the end, he may build using the thusly determined resources, and is awarded victory points for any finished buildings, which are recorded on the score card.

The game lasts fifteen turns or about 15-30 minutes, after which the player with the most victory points wins.

Note that the game has been designed for 1-4 players, meaning there is a solitaire version of the game, as well.

Recent versions include double-sided map sheets and instructions for Catan Dice Game Plus.
27710.name: Catan Dice Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Besprechung von Siedler von Catan - Das Würfelspiel
BGTG 71 - Sept. 19, 2007 - SR & Feedback (Settlers Dice, Canal Mania, Dschungelschatz)

27711.name: Marble Pursuit
27711.description:
A new game from retirees Del and Jan Schroeder. Details are sketchy, but, from the pictures, it looks a little like Trouble or Sorry played on a hexagonal board, which marbles for the pieces and cards for movement.

Publisher's website:
http://www.marblepursuit.com/

boardgamehonor: 2007 Kinderspielexperten "8-to-13-year-olds" Nominee
27712.description:
Together against the Shadow!
To free the world of the feared Shadow and his sinister master Capricorn must the players find the proper words.This is done by answering various questions such as "Name a bird!"
However, only letters visible on the board may be used in the answer. Everybody will immediately try to find a suitable word. When enough words have been found will Meggie, the heroine of the story, move towards goal; if not will Capricorn move forwards. Only if Meggie manage to reach goal first will the gamers win the game!

The game is based upon the highly succesful children's book "Inkheart" by Cornelia Funke. The novel is about the power of the word, and game designer Klaus Teuber of "Settlers of Catan" fame have captured the enthralling and tantalizing atmosphere of the struggle of young Meggy and her father Moe on one side against the evil Capricorn and his henchmen on the other.

Moe has the fantastic ability to read characters out of a story and into life. By this he brought Capricorn, the super-villain, into our world, who strifes to get all of his evil henchmen out of his book to help him with his bad deeds. But for this, he requires Moes services...

The trilogy has captivated children all over the world, and a major movie was released in March 2008.
So hopefully will we soon see an English language edition of this game.

This is a game in the Kosmos line of literature-based games.
27712.name: Tintenherz

boardgamehonor: 2007 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "9 years and up" Nominee
27713.description:
Tomoko ... a convoluted ball-rolling game for 2-4 sophisticated tacticians - that includes: 1 game board, 30 wooden balls, 36 pattern cards, 1 cotton bag, large print instructions.

Each player receives two pattern cards - both of which show a pattern of 9 balls.

Players try to achieve their patterns by pushing balls onto the board.

The card is laid on the table, by the player, each time a pattern is completed.
3 x 3 balls forms an ideal combination.

Thinking ahead before moving, to see the right pattern forming, will win the game - which ends when one player has collected 10 (5 or 3) pattern cards.
27713.name: Tomoko

27714.name: Hungry Homer
27714.description: Homer Simpson is guarding an entire tray of his favorite sugary snacks, and it's your job is to try to remove them from his clutches! The three different sizes of donut earn players different amounts when removed successfully. The bigger the donut, the more points earned - but the higher the risk of upsetting Homer! On each turn, players roll a dice to determine which size of donut they go for. Play continues until Homer reaches the end of his tether, when he shoots forward, sending the donuts flying. This is a game of risk, nerve and lots of fun.

27715.description: Selchow & Righter produced this simple children's game. Use dice and special cards to BIG GAME HUNT.
27715.name: Safari

27716.name: World Quest
27716.description: Simple to understand, use letter tiles and enjoy word building, be paid for words you make and what you know, travel through 32 countries, buy tour rights, charge tour fees and learn along the way. Fun to play - easy to learn. A winner in the 1987 Toy of the Year Awards.

27717.name: Dizzy Dryer
27717.description: Dizzy Dryer was a simple kid's game along the lines of Don't Wake Daddy... throw foam "clothes" into the dryer, hoping that Dizzy won't spit your clothes back out.

27718.name: Swim Quest
27718.description: Swim Quest was conceived as a board game that could be incorporated into swimming practices. It is designed to be constructed from waterproof materials, including a dry-erase board for keeping score. A spinner governs how many spaces the players move their pieces around a conventional track. The pieces are in thematic shapes: diver, freestyle, stopwatch, and pair of fins. Spaces on the board contain instructions for swimming activities, to be performed by the player who lands on the space (e.g., "4 laps, freestyle"). Some spaces have other instructions, such as "Go back 1 space" or "Do 20 crunches." Swim Quest has been awarded US Patent number 7125016B1.

boardgamehonor: 2007 Kinderspielexperten "8-to-13-year-olds" Nominee
27719.description:
From the designer, translation courtesy of BoardgameNews.com:

Trapper is an adventurous family game for 2-4 trappers from 10 years old, in which players gather tiles lying on the table. Trapper is suited especially well for two players.

Players are trappers in the Canadian wilderness, catching wild animals in the forests and lakes and searching for fungus and herbs. You ship your prey in canoes. As soon as one of your canoes is full, you sell the goods at the market. Both in the gathering of your prey and in the filling of your canoes, you need clever plans and foresight. Who will make the most valuable captures? The winner is the player who possesses the most money.

The game offers two different versions: A basic version in which luck plays a larger share and a somewhat more demanding version for tactically-minded players.

The basic game of Trapper is a simple game in the style of Verflixxt and Celtica that's suitable for a wide target audience. Good luck and tactics are about equal on the scales.

The somewhat more demanding version offers more tactical possibilities. How should one advance with the animal gathering? Which is more lucrative, getting a few larger and very valuable canoes or bringing many small canoes with different species to the market? Both strategies can lead to success.
27719.name: Trapper

27720.name: Gallery
27720.description:
From the box: GALLERY is a boardgame in which you must get the best painting collections and then show them in your own galleries, fully joining yourself into the exciting world of the art collecting.

The game mechanics are: "buy property", "strengthen property" and "wait for other players to land on it and have to then pay you". Its originality resides in the fact that, in order to "strengthen property", you must build up your art collection. The better your collection is, the more deadly it becomes to other players who must spend money when they land on it. Players compete among themselves to obtain the best sets of pictures to fill in their galleries.

Game components:
- A boardgame.
- 171 painting tiles.
- Two dice.
- A cloth bag.
- A wood hammer.
- 6 pions.
- 12 gallery property cards.
- 42 fortune cards.
- Million "Galleys" money.

27722.name: Battles for Empire
27722.description:
Battles for Empires is a Napoleonic miniatures system that is designed to move more quickly than many systems. It is focused primarily on small unit tactics and historical accuracy. Each turn represents 10 minutes, and each inch represents 50 yards. The system is simple and centered on tactics. The effect of individual leaders is also strong in the game.

The rules are well illustrated with photo examples throughout, with over 100 photos total. The rules are 40 pages long and 6 two-sided charts are included with the book.

Optional rules include rules for a variety of artillery and weather.

27723.description:
This game is played on an empty NxN square board (say 8x8):


TURNS - At each turn, each player must do the following actions:
First, drop a friendly stone on an empty cell;
Second, all pieces in the same horizontal and vertical rows move one cell nearer to the placed piece, if possible.

GOAL - If at the end of the move, there are any pieces that have an enemy piece at each diagonally adjacent cell, 4 in all, then the player with the most such pieces wins. If these numbers are equal, the game continues.


Online Play


Super Duper Games
27723.name: Attract

27724.name: Cascades
27724.description:
DROP - Each stone is dropped on an empty cell, next to and below a stone of the same color
MOVE - First player drops one stone at the first turn, then each player drops up to two stones (he may pass).
GOAL - Wins the player with more stones on the bottom row.


Some words from the author: For some time now [Apr 16, 2001] I have been toying with the idea of trying to model/abstract the flow of water carving out a mountainside. A related geometric pattern is the fractal on certain seashells. [...] The image in my mind is a root-pattern forming or tributaries of a river. [...] The game generalizes to any MxN board. Without more experience playing and "figuring it out" I don't know how M and N affect playability. My intuition suggests 8x8 (really 8x15 if you measured it at the bottom) is already nontrivial and 10x10 might be "tournament".

Online Play


Super Duper Games

27725.description:
This 2-player game uses a unique movement mechanic of pivots. The idea is to force your opponent into a position where they cannot move.

Online Play


Super Duper Games
27725.name: Squaredance

27726.description:
This game is played on the following 8x8 square board.

MOVE - Rams slide orthogonally (like chess Rooks).
When a Ram moves into an enemy Ram, it butts it one cell in the same direction.
This may set off a chain reaction of pushes if additional enemy Rams lie in the same direction. Friendly Rams don't get butted.
Captures are made by either butting an enemy Ram off the board or into a friendly Ram.
A Ko Rule is in effect: One may not play in such a way that would recreate a board position that has just occured previously in the game.

GOAL - The first player that captures all enemy Rams or moves into the opposite corner wins.


Online Play


Super Duper Games
27726.name: Aries

27727.name: Fortress Illinois
27727.description:
This is a very amusing send up of Fortress America. Set in 2024, Fortress Illinois supposes a future in which Iowa, Missouri, Indiana, and Wisconsin invade Illinois. The game begins when Illinois destroys Gary, Indiana without warning. (Can you really blame them?) President Bobby Knight III leads the four states, which join forces and invade the Flatlanders in an effort to wipe out their leader, Governor Daley IV.

The game consists of a map and cards. It can not be played without owning Fortress America. This game was packed with and offered free with purchase Magic & Tactics' Axis & Allies homage, Middle East Combat.

27728.name: Shift
27728.description:
From the publisher's web site:

Shift is a board game for 2-6 players.
It is about Love, Fear, Work, Relationships and Human Behavior and it might just change your life.

Have you ever wondered why some see a sunset and immediately become grateful while others see a sunset and immediately think, "Man, where did the day go?"

Or why some people can spill a glass of wine and think that will make a great story, while others will see it as having the same catastrophic impact as the sinking of The Titanic, and then conclude it was the vineyards fault for making the wine? Then, get these answers and more… Shift is a personality x-ray machine that enables you to see what’s driving your friends and most importantly, what’s driving you.

All it takes is a shift in thought to shift your life…

Play Shift and Make your Move.

Home Page: http://www.shiftthegame.com/

27729.name: Kalle Anka Spelet: Guldgrävarjakten
27729.description: Each player takes on the role as one of five Disney characters. Each turn you move a number of spaces, as indicated by your player board. Some turns, you must draw a card and follow its instructions. Keep moving, until you reach the second board were you are trying to strike gold (represented by a ball) by putting your plastic pickax in holes. The Swedish title translates to "The Donald Duck Game - The Gold-diggers Hunt"

27730.description:
Goal of this French pirate themed game is to gather the highest reputation after 3 or 4 expeditions.

Each round consists of 2 phases. The first one is the expedition where the players resolve tasks from event cards and try to amass as much as possible of gold. The second phase is about "The Tavern" where you try to defend your gold or steal it from other players.

During the game you may hire pirates or one of your fellow pirates may become captain. When embarking you try to get the best places for your mates. Maybe there is a mutiny or even the destruction of the ship. Lucky you are when a port is near to save your life and repair your ship.

Event cards offer tasks for the crew and if they succeed they gain gold or reputation, but if they fail they may also lose it.
27730.name: Eollis: Pirates des Vents

27731.name: Houdini
27731.description:
Houdini! celebrates what many deem the Golden Age of Magic, the first few decades of the 20th century. The game is named for the most famous - but not necessarily the “greatest” - “magician” of all time, Houdini (née Ehrich Weiss). In the game, each player is a historically famous magician rated for his skill, strength and luck, all used when trying to make a name and fortune for himself.

Players win the game by amassing the most Victory Points. Players gain Victory Points for Fame and Wealth, and they gain those by playing Cards that enable them to perform Escapes and Illusions, announce/answer Challenges, gain ownership of theaters, and survive the demands and dangers of doing all of this. Each “trick” will require differing levels of skill, and many will sap the stamina and strength of the Magician. Performance of tricks earns Money and Fame. The winner is the player with the most Fame and Money at game’s end.

27732.name: Doraemon Mao Xian Wang
27732.description:
Doraemon Mao Xian Wang directly translates as Doraemon Adventure King. This made-in-Hong-Kong board game uses the popular Japanese cartoon, Doraemon, as its theme.

Doraemon is a lovable cat-robot from the 22nd century, who is sent back in time to present-day Japan to help Nobita, a pitiful school kid who is best described as a loser. Doraemon wears a magical pouch on his tummy from which he produces the most amazing gadgets to help Nobita, but Nobita somehow always manages to misuse them.

The game belongs to the large family of 'Millionaire' clones, which is itself derived from Monopoly. Players take on the role of one of four characters from the cartoon series: Doraemon; Nobita; Shizuka (Nobita's girlfriend); and Dorami (Doraemon's sister). Each player has a nifty miniature figurine to move around the track. Dice-rolls move the figurines and players earn or spend money according to where they land. Instead of properties, players land on adventures which they can 'purchase' and other players landing there in future have to pay the owner of the adventure. There are also chance cards.

The manufacturer, Sun Hing Toys, makes several other Doraemon-themed board games.

27733.name: AD2222
27733.description: A set of miniatures rules covering sci-fi fighter combat, in the well regarded Peter Pig rule sets range designed by the RFCM Team. There is a supporting set of miniatures.

27734.name: Mimix
27734.description: The board shows 16 different faces that are smiling, grinning and so on. Players in turn draw cards which show one of the faces. Now the player tries to imitate the shown face. The game continues as long as any player acquires 5 of these Mimix-cards.

27735.name: Pharmacy
27735.description:
From the publisher:

Pharmacy, the edgy board game that offers players a fun-filled "trip" around the game board with questions on legal and illegal drugs, alcohol and pop culture. When "Pharmacy" is played according to the directions, the objective is to earn points by answering the Trivia Card questions correctly and to be lucky enough to have good karma and earn extra points with Karma Cards. Also included in Pharmacy are ten different characters, with a male and female version of each. Choose your character wisely because you will experience the karma of your character. Characters include a guru with questionable ethics, a nicotine-addicted and sexually adventurous yuppie, a gambler, an actor, a crooked Politician, a farmer and, of course, a hippie.

27736.description:
Dead of Night is a 1 to 6 player game based on scenarios you might recognize from various zombie films. There is no 'Zombie Master' here: all the players are on the same side, all working together to survive, although the option to use other players as zombie bait while you grab all the guns and lock yourself in the cellar is there if you prefer.
Either way, you will need to use strategy and your (fresh and spicy) brains as well as chainsaws and shotguns to make it through the night.

Each scenario has a location to be explored, and an objective to be fulfilled, but if things don't go well just survival may be enough. Cards drawn throughout the game may help or hinder your progress, but as the night draws on you can be sure things are going to get much worse before you see the sun again.

The game ends when somebody fulfils the main objective (eg, escaping in a fuelled up vehicle), or at daybreak, which brings respite in the form of an advancing army patrol. If you can survive until the end of the game, you are a winner. The survivor who best fulfils their objectives will come out on top.

Expanded by:

Mall of the Dead
27736.name: Dead of Night

27737.name: Hockey Stars
27737.description: The main goal of this game is to score more goals than the other team. Players can make multiple actions with the puck in order to put the puck in the opponent's net. The game contains real hockey rules like offside, penalty, fighting and it is divided into three periods. The game combines the elements of strategy and chance.

27738.name: Chupacabra
27738.description:
Theme
You are the Chupacabra! Your very presence strikes fear into the hearts of Goat Herders everywhere as you live to suck blood; Goat blood!

In this game you want to organize packs of Chupacabras to tackle the growing herds of goats. Be aware that while you are strong creatures, you can be outnumbered which makes for a lighter feast as goats will attempt to defend themselves.

In Brief
Each player has a hand of cards (starting with 5, and variable after that, with a max. of 8). When played, these cards add to the number of a particular pack Chupacabras (3 different types) that you are amassing to attack a particular herd of goats (again, 3 different types), while at the same time add to (or subtract from) the number of goats in a particular herd and.

The player(s) that have amassed the most Chupacabras in a particular color gets the opportunity to strike against the herds of goats of the corresponding color. If you outnumber goats you are attacking, you can eat well, but if they outnumber you, then watch out.

Object of the Game
In Chupacabra, 2 – 4 players struggle to amass packs of Chupacabras to overpower Herds of Goats. Players must push their hand to the limit timing their attacks, and knowing when to call off their packs. Often players will come to the aid of the goat herds to prevent them from becoming easy pickings for other players. The player with the best score after eating 25 Goats, wins.

Contents
48 Chupacabra Cards
1 Game Board
3 Goat Markers
4 Chupacabra Markers
1 Rulesheet (single Page)

boardgamehonor: 2010 Charles S. Roberts Best Post-WW2 Era Board Wargame Nominee
27739.description:
Hearts and Minds: Vietnam 1965-1975 is a card-driven game covering the American buildup of troops and arms in Southeast Asia as to our decision to begin troop withdrawal: 1965-1975. The game is quick (3-6 hours) and clean (map using area movement). Hearts and Minds uses most major events of the period, including proposed events such as the Macnamara Line which was never actually built. Although nominally a combat game, the mechanisms actually revolve around both sides occupying South Vietnamese provinces for propaganda purposes. The heart of the game is political influence. There is little doubt that the Allied player will eventually withdraw his American boys from the quagmire, but the question is, how quickly and in what numbers?

Hearts and Minds contains 80 cards, tokens to represent the American army, the ARVN army, the NVA army, VC units of varying hidden strength, the Cambodian army, the Laotian army and a small contingent of international allies. Turn tokens, withdrawal tokens, reduced movement tokens as well CAS (Close Air Support), communist Air Suppression and artillery are also included. More rules cover Air Cavalry, naval support, Riverine interdiction, and bombers. Untried troops are a liability in the game; Veteran troops are a necessity. Ultimately, the Communist player must deal the American such a crushing public relations disaster that he will abandon his Southeast Asian allies before the momentum of those allies stalemates the irreversible infiltration of South Vietnam.
27739.name: Hearts and Minds: Vietnam 1965-1975
boardgamepodcastepisode: I've Been Diced! episode 43: A Descent into frustration, and a belated best/worst of 2012 list

27740.name: Canadian Football Game
27740.description:
With the aid of 3 spinners the team on offense tries to move the football down field for a touchdown.

Spinner A represents passing play attempts, Spinner B running attempts and Spinner C, kicks, field goals or conversion attempts.

NOTE: Unlike American football, Canadian football only allows 3 downs to make 10 yards.

27741.name: Rail Masters Trust Company
27741.description:
From the publisher:

"Venture into America's romantic past. It is time when the young Nation is struggling to survive the tragic Civil War years in which over 620,000 lives were lost; families torn asunder; and the assassination of a President is being secretly planned. It is also a time when a small group of men rose against all odds amassing great fortunes and political power by laying their steel ribbons across America's vast plains and over her towering and majestic mountains. These were America's RAIL MASTERS....

The year is 1862 and President Lincoln has just signed the Pacific Railroad Act granting you $100,000 and a steam locomotive. Your assignment is to safely travel across the United States and deliver five special spikes to your holding company. The first Railroad to deliver all five spikes wins.

Who will be the next RAIL MASTER?"

The Rail Masters Trust Company is a Trivial Pursuit inspired train trivia game with added economic and pick up and deliver mechanics. Players take the role of one of six holding companies from 1862 and start with $100,000 granted by the government. Starting from the roundhouse, players roll and move around the board answering train trivia questions to get extra moves. There are six spike squares of five different colors the players are aiming to land on where they can purchase a spike from the government. The train playing pieces have slots to hold two spikes maximum, so spikes must be delivered to the roundhouse before more can be picked up. On Rail Crossing spaces, "community chest" type cards are drawn that decrease or increase a player's money. Players can sell their spikes to any other player at any time for any price.

The trivia questions are all multiple choice or true and false, so you don't need to be a train trivia expert to be competitive. If playing against a REAL train buff, you can always take away the multiple choice from that player and make them answer the questions outright to even the field...

27742.name: Speed Buggy Game
27742.description:
Roll and move, start-Finish game. But a couple of interesting strategy rules that takes it into an advanced children's game.

Players use a the built-in spinner. They must move their piece in a straight line. Players may not move over or through other players. Also any player who reaches a wall and has extra movement loses a turn. As a result there is some strategy to play when you try to block the other players.

A simple but enjoyable game.

27743.description:
You emerge from hyperspace with your fuel tanks empty. Expecting to simply refuel and leave, you instead find a dead station, spinning powerless and silent in the eternal void. With no other source of fuel, you have no choice but to search the cold, ebon corridors of Void Station 57.

Void 57 continues the tradition set by Melee and Wizard, updated into a science fiction environment. The game comes with brief rules book, game pieces, game board and scenario book to play through.
27743.name: Legends of Time and Space: Void Station 57

27744.name: Nubian Jak
27744.description:
Nubian Jak was created in Britain and developed in the USA. It has 8 topics: Leaders & Icons, TV & Film, Modern History, Art & Literature, Sport, Science & Engineering, General Knowledge, Music & Theater. The game combines wit, skill and luck to outplay your opponents by getting three pyramid pieces from one area of the board to three new homes.

Nubian Jak uses multiple-choice questions on cards with the correct answer giving an instruction to move forward or throw again. In most cases the least likely of the 3 options carries a penalty for the wrong answer. There is also a Super Challenge Format, which is played by asking the topic card questions without giving the multiple choice options as clues. The correct answer gives the bonus, while any wrong answer incurs the penalty on the card.

Nubian Jak can either be played in singles involving 2-8 players or in teams of 3 with each Jak represented by a player.

boardgamehonor: 2007 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork/Presentation Nominee
2007 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
2007 Golden Geek Best Gamer's Board Game Nominee
2007 International Gamers Awards - General Strategy; Multi-player Nominee
2008 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork/Presentation Nominee
2008 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
27746.description:
In Colosseum each player is a Roman impresario - producing great spectacles in his or her arena in the hopes of attracting the most spectators. Players earn wealth and glory for each event run, using it to create ever more ambitious events. They will need to improve their arena, find the best performers, lure the Emperor and his nobles, and manage assets for long-term success to be granted the title of Grand Impresario, with tales of your extraordinary spectacles acclaimed throughout the empire.

As commanded by the Emperor, the greatest celebration in Roman history has continued unabated for 99 days. All of Rome has borne witness to the grandest spectacles the empire has ever seen— all to commemorate the opening of the Amphitheatrum Flavium, the Colosseum.

Tens of thousands have flocked to the city to experience the sight of a hundred gladiators in battle...rare and exotic animals prowling the arena floor...and to hear and see the greatest musicians and entertainers from throughout the empire. But these events have only been a prelude to today — the closing finale! As a master impresario you have prepared for this moment your entire life. Titus himself has taken his seat in the Emperor’s Loge. At the drop of his hand, the final spectacle will begin. Your moment in the sun has come...
27746.name: Colosseum
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGB Volume 39 - Boardgame Podcast Awards plus Session Reviews with Colosseum and Owner's Choice
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 015 – Top 10 Mechanisms
Episode 11: Isaac Childres interview - Gloomhaven, Nations the Dice Game, Castles of Burgundy
Episode 17 – Days of Wonder – Neuheiten Frühjahr 2007
Episode 23: Tail Feathers Review - Jamey Stegmaier Interview
Top 10 Favorite Board Games of All Time
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 65!!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 80

27747.name: Q-FIGHTER
27747.description: Take your one-man fighter into q-space and engage your opponent head on in a duel to the death. Two players, each using one of the two enclosed play books, try to maneuver each other into their own firing arcs using the easy to use movement charts given on each page. As you and your opponent move, you flip to a new page, which shows your new position and sensor displays.

27748.name: Utterly Outrageous Drinking Games
27748.description:
A collection of drinking games in a tin, bottle shaped party set. In total there are 25 drinking games such as pucker up, drag queen, kingpin (beer pong), the probe, warthog and bump and grind.

The set includes a pencil and paper, 25 drinking game rule cards, instructions, 1 ribbon, playing cards, straws, dice and a beer pong ball.

Games start with a minimum of 2, 3 or 4 players depending on the card.

Play lasts as long as there are players.

27749.name: Truth, Dare or Chocolate
27749.description:
From the publisher's catalog:

From the makers of the wildly popular Strip Chocolate, comes a new and revealingly delicious adult dessert game - Truth, Dare or Chocolate. Chocoholics has given the age-old game of Spin the Bottle a new chocolate twist. If you are hungry for dessert and some very seductive action, turn the lights on low, spread out a comforter by a cozy fire and get ready for some embarrassing, but titillating fun. You will earn points for telling truths, taking dares and tattooing your partner with delicious Chocoholics Body Frosting. Be the first to earn 20 points and you get to present your partner with your Ultimate Dare! Chocoholics Truth, Dare or Chocolate will be the most memorable dessert experience you have ever had.

27750.name: The Official Tour de France Game
27750.description:
A very large bicycle race game, published in Denmark in 1998. The first edition contained stats for riders in the 1998 race season. Other seasons were to follow.
The game was so large it actually came in two big boxes. Total weight was just over 15 lbs. (7kg)! One box contained the basic components to play and the other contained the specific components required to play the 1998/1999 race season. With the modular boards, just about any race course the Tour de France covers could be duplicated.
Each rider stats card will determine if they are a star rider, mountain or sprint specialist or a good all around rider. These cards are based on real rider’s stats. At the start of the game each player will build a team of 9 players that includes one star rider and the team you build to support him.
The box came with four rule sets: Danish, German, French & English.

27751.name: Organic Soup
27751.description: Amass your carbon, hydrogen, nitrogen, and oxygen atoms to form your first basic molecules. React them together according to the recipes to make bigger ones, while guarding your leftovers from your opponents reactions. Make an amino acid to create life and win!

27753.name: Regimente of Foote
27753.description: A set of miniatures rules covering English Civil War combat, in the well regarded Peter Pig rule sets range designed by the RFCM Team. There is a supporting set of miniatures.

27754.name: Bloody Barons
27754.description: A set of medieval miniatures rules covering combat in The Wars of the Roses, in the well regarded Peter Pig rule sets range designed by the RFCM Team. There is a supporting range of miniatures.

27755.name: Patrols in the Sudan
27755.description: A set of miniatures rules covering late 19th Century colonial combat in The Sudan (British vs Fuzzy Wuzzies/Dervishes), in the well regarded Peter Pig rule sets range designed by the RFCM Team. There is a supporting range of miniatures.

27756.name: Stratiotika
27756.description:
A FREE full campaign game for use with Hoplomachia (although it is perfectly good as a stand alone boardgame) Right out of the pages of Thucydides! Two full scenarios included!

In Stratiotika, you will now be able to make war at the city-state level; you can enrage city dwellers by trampling their crops, organize markets to feed your troops, build counter-walls to blockade rebellious cities, or infiltrate troops within their walls with the help of traitors and take the town on the sly. Not only can you openly call on their assemblies to vote to join your cause, but you can actually debate with your political opponents using historic speeches to sway those who are
“on the fence”. You can lose allies to the harvest, ships to dangerous waters, walls to earthquakes, and cities to a more cunning and silver-tongued foe!

27757.name: Metropoli Eurooppa
27757.description: The game shows Europe as it was back in 1980s. All the independent states of the time are shown on the board as their flags as a way to identify them. The idea of the game is to try to gather as many different flags for yourself as possible .

27758.description:
Two landlords are fighting over a piece of land. They decide to make a deal. To Take turns they can move across the land horizontally, vertically or diagonally. The player who manages to enclose the most pieces of land becomes the owner.

HOW TO PLAY LANDLORD

1. The two players put their landlords in the starting position.
2. They take turns moving the landlords over one of the paths. As soon as a player succeeds in enclosing a triangle, the enclosed land becomes the property of that player. He then covers the triangle with a playing piece of his color. The land is now his and can never be recaptured.
3. Take note: it is also possible to enclose several triangles at the same time.
4. The game ends when all triangles on the playing board have been claimed as property. The winner is the player who owns the most pieces of land at the end of the game.

Not to be confused with:

Landlord! (1992), a card game from Rio Grande Games
The Landlord's Game (1904), a progenitor of Monopoly
27758.name: Landlord

27759.description:
A 50 card addition to the El Grande: König & Intrigant expansion. Cards unique to this expansion are Fiesta (15), Spionage (value 25), Putsch (35), 6 nimmt! (66), Provinz (75), Königlicher Schutz (95), Entfernen (125), Sonderwertung (135), Sonderwertung (145), Sonderwertung (155), 10 cards in neutral color, so can be added to every card set.

A complete set of 50 cards (no box) was sent from Hans im Glück on demand and a prepaid envelope.

Gives players an additional 10 card choices when building their respective K&E play decks. cards can also be used together with Player's Edition.

Expands:

El Grande when played with El Grande: König & Intrigant
El Grande when played with El Grande: König & Intrigant – Player's Edition




The english version of these cards is included in:

The El Grande Expansions
El Grande (Decennial Edition)
El Grande Big Box
27759.name: El Grande: König & Intrigant – Unverkäufliche Sonderkarten

27760.description:
Traders & Barbarians is distributed as the third major expansion for The Settlers of Catan, although it is actually a compilation of small expansions and variants. (It is independent of the Seafarers and Cities & Knights expansions, but can be combined with them.)

All of the variants and three of the scenarios have been available from various sources in Europe and the United States or through official websites. The Great Rivers and the Fishermen of Catan have been expanded somewhat for this expansion through extra tiles and player pieces.

This compilation includes 5 scenarios:

The Fishermen of Catan - Originally released in the 05/2006 Spielbox magazine and then subsequently released in Games Quarterly magazine. Expanded in this edition.
The Rivers of Catan - Originally released in the Atlantis scenario box, then subsequently in Games Quarterly magazine as "The Great River". Expanded in this edition to include two rivers, one occupying 4 tiles, and one occupying 3.
The Great Caravan - Originally released as a free expansion in Germany.
Barbarian Invasion - New in this edition. - Barbarians are invading Catan and the players have to try to stop them with new knight pieces. This plays very similarly to the flood mechanic in the Atlantis scenario from the Atlantis and Das Buch scenario packs.
Traders & Barbarians - New in this edition. - You get new hexes, one for the castle, one to produce glass, and one to produce marble. You try to rebuild Catan after the invasion. You get gold and victory points if you finish tasks in the castle, but to do so you have to travel back and forth to the castle on roads and undeveloped paths. There are still some barbarians around who interfere with trade routes.




It also includes 4 minor variants:

2-Player Rules - Use the new "Commercial Chips" to force trade with your opponent. Use 3rd and 4th neutral player to block your opponent. Also available online: Klaus2player.pdf
Catan Event Cards - Originally released in the Atlantis scenario box, then subsequently released for sale separately. Replaces the dice with a deck of cards to minimize randomness.
The Harbormaster Card - Originally released in the Atlantis scenario box, then subsequently available online: harbormaster.pdf. Gives two victory points to the player with the most harbor points.
Friendly Robber Rules




This game belongs to the Catan Series.
27760.name: Catan: Traders & Barbarians

27762.description: Axles and Alloys is a FREE miniatures game about futuristic vehicular combat. Build your car, then send it out to combat other players to see who the King of the Road really is...
27762.name: Axles and Alloys

27763.name: Fairy Tale Road Rage
27763.description:
A cut-and-assemble board game printed in the end-papers of "LittleLit", a collection of fairy tales as depicted by independent comic book artists. The game, by "Jimmy Corrigan: Smartest Kid on Earth" author Chris Ware, is a fairly simple roll-and-move progression where players "drive" the various denizens (Big Bad Wolf, Frog Prince, Grandma) of a blighted, suburban fairy-land in an effort to gather like-colored "story chits". The chits are assembled on a separate board for each character, and "will complete a story of amusing and rakish details- particularly if read aloud, and with dramatic relish." Certain spaces, when landed on, have special, game altering effects, such as "Heisenberg Attack", which forces all players to switch characters with the person to their right.

"One person play: All rules are the same, though exchange between other players is, obviously, impossible. Do not despair; someday you will grow up to be a famous cartoonist and all of the kids who made fun of you will have miserable jobs and be desperately unhappy, but you will get to draw stories for lots of money about how you still hate them all."

27764.name: DJ Mole
27764.description:
(from box description)

Take part in the funniest Phone-in ever!

DJ Mole "King of Rock 'n' Roll" is the radio host with the most in this groovy poptastic quiz!

Match the pictures on your cards to DJ Mole's silly sound-bites in a race to win his radio quiz"

Just listen to the sound-bites the DJ plays. If any of your cards has instruments or sounds from the clip, then hit those phones!! For every correct phone-in you lose a card. Get rid of all your cards first and you'll be the WINNER BABY!

27765.name: Top of the Pops
27765.description:
(From the box description)

"Can you survive the cut and thrust of the pop world and shop you've got what it takes to become 'No 1'?
Be the first to work your way up the charts collecting tokens for your singing and dancing ability and your knowledge of the pop world."

boardgamehonor: 2011 Le Lys Enfant Finalist
2014 Guldbrikken Best Children's Game Nominee
27766.description:
Die Siedler von Catan: Junior is, as you might expect, a junior edition of The Settlers of Catan, and while the game play remains mostly the same – with players collecting and trading resources in order to build things, gain more resources and score points – the setting is new.

Instead of being settlers, though, the players are now pirates, with pirate warehouses located on islands in the waters around Catan and ships sailing in those waters. Pirate warehouses are equivalent to settlements in Catan, and the player receive resources from these warehouses whenever a die roll matches the number showing on that island. These resources take the form of equipment cards, and the resources are wood, wool, rum, sabers and gold. With these, players construct ships and more pirate warehouses or buy development cards. Instead of a robber, players must now beware of a Ghost Pirate, which can block the resources normally provided by a warehouse.

Each player starts with two pirate warehouses, and the first player to build seven warehouses wins. In order to build a new warehouse, however, a player must go by ship from an existing warehouse to a new construction site, which thus keeps players alternating between constructing ships and warehouses.

Aside from the change in theme, other changes between The Settlers of Catan and Catan: Junior include the elimination of cities (i.e., warehouses can't be upgraded) and the distance rule between settlements, resources allocated by the roll of one die instead of a pair of D6s, and the introduction of a marketplace that allows trading with the bank. At the start of the game, one equipment card of each type is placed in the marketplace; on a player's turn, he can exchange one card in hand for a card in the marketplace. At certain times in the game, the marketplace is cleared and reset to feature one equipment card of each type.
27766.name: Catan Junior

27767.description:
Episches Munchkin is a German-language set of 33 reference cards that contain the special Epic Munchkin rules for races and classes between levels 11 and 20. They are the same size as regular Munchkin cards. In addition, it includes a metal level counter, similar to the Munchkin Level Counter released by Steve Jackson Games.

The reference cards cover all classes and races for the following Munchkin games:

Munchkin 1-3
Star Munchkin 1 & 2
Munchkin Bites 1 & 2
Super Munchkin 1 & 2
Munchkin Fu




Note that nothing in this expansion has an in-game effect -- it's just reference cards and a level counter.

Part of the Munchkin series
27767.name: Episches Munchkin

27768.name: Finis ton Assiette
27768.description:
It's dinner time! On today's menu: raviolis, strawberry tarts, chocolate eclairs… Yum yum! Each player has 3 plates and must finish them as fast as possible, by using the “Fork” cards of the right color. And thanks to the magic fork, some lucky players will finish even more quickly. But beware! One can play nasty tricks to another by switching plates or by adding extra plates to an opponent…

A game by Pierre-Nicolas Lapointe illustrated by Arnaud Quéré 2 to 4 players from 6 & up. Strong points: A cute and simple game you can sink your teeth into! A variant for younger players (without the special cards) is available.

In the box: a deck of 46 cards (14 “Plate”, 27 “Fork”, 2 “Extra Plate”, 3 “Plate Switch”, 2 rule summaries)

27769.name: Drill For Oil: Oil Well Game
boardgamepublisher: J. D. Neff & Son Game Company
27769.description: Drill For Oil is a game where players can enjoy the fun and excitement of drilling for oil as in real life. One player is elected banker. The banker issues $10,000 to each player. (The banker is considered a player as well.) After unfolding the board, the banker shuffles the 10 drill for oil cards and places one face down on each site. To drill for oil, it costs $10,000. The banker goes first, and must state which oil well he wants to drill for oil on. He must then appropriate $10,000 to drill. There are 10 stock certificates representing 10% ownership in a well being drilled. The player drilling may sell all the stock or part of the stock. He must, however, offer a percentage of stock depending on the amount of players. (50% for 2 player, 60% for 3 or 4 players, 80% for 5 players.) At times a player may have to buy all the stock in a well if no other players want to invest in it. After the $10,000 is raised, the player pays the bank and flips the card. If it says dry hole, the stock is worthless. If it says have struck oil, each player who invested receives the dividend stated on the card. (Amounts vary on 6 of the cards, 4 are dry holes.) Play continues to the left until all 6 oil producing wells have been drilled. The game then ends and the player with the most money wins.

27770.name: Drive-Rite
27770.description:
Drive-Rite
(Recommended Age 6 to Adult)

"Test Yourself
In a Game of Fun
Drive A Car
Like it Should be Done"

Drive-Rite is a basic roll and move game where each player competes to move their car down the path and be the first to reach "home".

Movement is accomplished by rolling two 6-sided dice to determine your speed. Each road along the board has a posted speed limit. If on your turn, you exceed the speed limit, you have to roll another dice and move that many spaces backwards as a penalty for speeding. There are a few different routes you may take (each with different speeds) as well as various spaces on the board where you must stop.

Overall the game is very simple and there is little strategy.

27771.name: Flip Flap Flop
27771.description: A card game of 48 cards with every card having the picture of a cartoony face on it. The face, however, is slightly different on each card and there are eight sets of different expressions with six cards of each expression. The cards are dealt to all players face down to make a deck. Each turn all players simultaneously reveal the top card of their deck. If a player notices three identical faces he yells out "Flip Flap Flop". If correct, that player takes the three identical cards. Unclaimed cards are left on the table. A player who makes an incorrect call may not call on the following round but must play a card as usual. When one player has six sets of FLIP FLAP FLOP cards, the game ends. Players count their cards and the player with the most cards wins.

27772.name: Alla mot en
27772.description:
A trivia game based on the Swedish TV show "Alla mot en" (All against one), better known elsewhere as "1 VS 100".

From the back of the box translated from Swedish:
One player is game leader, one player answers to the question and the rest acts as the 100 contestants in the audience which the challenger are trying to beat.

While the challenger chooses question difficulty and thinks about the answer, the rest are betting their markers on one or more of the alternative answers. Every marker on the wrong answer are discarded and the further a challenger moves on the board, the higher the winning sum.

For 2-4 players or in teams.

27773.name: Ärligt talat
27773.description: "Ärligt talat" (Honestly spoken) is a Swedish trivia game that tells the truth about what your friends like and don't like.

27774.name: Elsie's Milkman Game
27774.description:
This game was manufactured as a promotional item for Bordens Dairy

Object of the game is to unload/deliver the contents of their delivery truck to residences or the Supermarket and be the first to return to the Dairy.

Each player takes 1 Truck card and places small product cards representing assorted dairy products in their respective spaces.

Colored pawns represent the trucks as they move about the board making deliveries.

Dice rolls determine movement.

Each residence has symbols representing a delivery request. Landing exactly on a doorstep allows for product delivery and once all products have been delivered to that residence the order can not be duplicated. Any player may unload at the supermarket.

Players must observe street direction arrows and may only go in the direction or directions indicated.

There are also special instruction cards that effect game play.

27775.name: Destination Delhi!
27775.description:
Destination Delhi! is a roll-and-move game where players are taxi drivers collecting fares around Delhi. The game board is a map of Delhi featuring 10 different tourist attractions and players draw destination cards telling them where they must move to next. The attractions are:

Rashtrapthi Bhawan
Red Fort
Bahai Temple
Connaught Place
India Gate
Jama Masjid
Janter Manter
Lodi Gardens
Qurb Minar
Raj Ghat

27776.name: Mister Whiskers and the Wrigleybottom Jewel Robbery
27776.description:
A game in the same vein as 'Mad Libs':

A chosen player becomes the narrator, who reads the 'crime story'. When the narrator comes to a blank in the text, the active player (which may include the narrator) draws a card from the deck and quickly reads it aloud.

The cards contain words which tend toward absurdist relationships with the rest of the text of the story. Some of the cards are worth points to the player who drew them.

The game also features 30 blank cards, for you to supply the names of friends, etc.

The winner is the player with the most points (which were gained from random card draw). The game is therefore entirely random as presented.

27778.name: Bombshells
27778.description:
Armed with a ren faire costume and a Player's Handbook, you've decided to cross the final frontier: dating. Vie for the attentions of the bombshells, but watch out... who knows what mood they're in.

On a player's turn, a Bombshell is chosen that the players will vie for. Each player who wants to approach the Bombshell places one of their Offer cards face down, within the range of cards that the Bombshell will accept.

Then the Bombshell's Mood is revealed, which says how the Bombshell is scored and if there's a card limit.

There is a round of adding to offers from those who approached the Bombshell. The offers are revealed, and whoever has the best offer scores the Bombshell.

27779.name: Zombies of Los Muerte High
27779.description:
Zombies have infested Los Muerte High! As your teachers shamble about trying to eat your brains, you begin to formulate a plan. It might just work, but it’s going to take everything in your locker to convince enough students to help get it done.

Two characters come up that provide icons towards completing your plan (which you need at the end of the game) and popularity points.

Players bid a card face down from their hand. Highest bid takes first choice of cards but loses their bid card, second highest bid takes the remaining card and keeps their bid.

However, sometimes a Zombie is among the character cards who makes completing a plan more difficult.

27780.name: Nerd Trivia
27780.description:
Most trivia games cover the boring stuff: history, geography, sports... who cares? Nerd Trivia is the first game to tackle trivia about what's truly important: D&D, Lord of the Rings, Star Trek, Star Wars, and much more. It's nerd, or nothing!

The GM reads a category and a difficulty of a trivia question. Bet on which of your friends you think knows the answer. Then the question is read, and everyone answers. Anyone getting it right scores points. If you pick someone who gets it right, score bonus points. If you were the only one to pick that person, score extra points. But if three or more people picked that person, no bonus points...

27781.name: Jetsetters
27781.description:
Spiel De Jahres-nominated game designer Stephen Glenn brings this card game about heading around the globe to the world's hottest cities. Finally in print, Jetsetters has been Hippodice-recognized as a quality card game.

Deal cards from the deck to the center of the table equal to the number of players + 1.

Each card has a city, a transportation mode, a point value, and a turn order number. Each player selects a card, and the remaining card goes in the Travel Agency.

The turn order number determines what order people will pick cards in the next round.

At the end of the game, players score points based on which cities they own that are in the Travel Agency, and for having the most of a particular transportation mode.

27782.name: DHV Round 1
27782.description:
Drinking. History. Violence. A bar brawl of historical proportions. Round 1 includes two characters: Mahatma Zombie and Sintaclaws, and can be combined with DHV Round 2 to support up to 4 players.

As the attacker, play attacks, struggles, or booze, and the defender plays defends, struggles, or boozes.

Alternate cards until one player chooses to pass, wherein all the cards are resolved in reverse order.

Some cards will be blocked, some cards will be enhanced or reduced based on what was played, and many cards will deal damage to the opponent.

Refill your hand, reverse roles, and continue until sober.

Available from RobotMartini.com.

Combines with:

DHV Round 2

27783.name: Nine Months & Counting
27783.description: Players travel along a track with squares representing the 40 weeks of pregnancy. To advance, they must complete a task such as answering a pregnancy-related trivia question, unscrambling a baby name, or drawing a pregnancy-related item. Complete the game to receive a brand-new baby.

27784.name: My First Operation
27784.description:
(From the box description)

"Roly the pig has been a real greedy-guts and gobbled up too much food.

Now he's got tummy ache and needs an operation.

Remove the food from his tummy, but don't hurt him or his snout will light up and he'll squeal!"

Kids version of operation for 4 years old and up.

27785.name: Shop 'Til You Drop
27785.description:
(From the box description):

Shop Till You Drop is the game where a roll of the die tells you what to drop in and what to take out. But mind the jittery trolley!

Load up too much and it'll collapse! But taking things out can be just as tricky. Carefully does it or Yikes! You'll send your shopping flying! One false move and you're out!

27786.name: Fluctuat
27786.description:
The game is played selling and buying highly coveted items like stones, stamps, and cheese. The object is to collect the most money.

This is a free print and play game from Neroludic. Currently only available in French.

27787.name: Gaia
27787.description:
In Gaia players add tiles to the ecosystem and make bets on each species. There five different types of species in the game.

This is a free print and play game from Neuroludic. It is currently only available in French.

27788.description:
Vermix roared as the zeppelin’s cannons blasted into him, the great dragon screaming in terrible pain as the cannon ball smashed into his armored hide. Any other dragon might have been blow from the skies with such a volley of lead shot, but Vermix was no weakling, but rather one of the true kings of the skies. The wizards of Tor thought they could take the dragon lord’s territory without much of a fight from the might red dragon, but these wizards were fools, for Vermix never surrendered and had yet to lose a battle for control of the clouds that he called home.

This is Cloud Wars', yet another Mini-Game from Bad Baby Production. In Cloud Wars, you and other players take on the role of mighty air ships, eagle riders and lords of cloud castles as you battle for control of the skies above a fantasy world. The first expansion for the Dragon Wars game, now players can lead forces of wizard forged zeppelins and marshal squadrons of might eagle riders. Fully compatible with Dragon War, have fun and battle for the skies.

Using a fast turn based system; the combat is swift, the excitement nail biting and the strategy intense. Do you dare enter the world of dragons, wizards and cannons…
27788.name: Cloud Wars

27789.description:
The Harbour of Rotterdam
At least 370 million tons of goods are being processed in the Rotterdam Harbour. From South America all sorts of exotic fruits are delivered to the Merwehaven and are being processed to all kinds of fruit juices. The Vulcaanhaven on the edge of Vlaardingen is specially equipped for the transfer or processing of grains from North America. Petroleum comes from the Middle East in large quantities to be transferred in gasoline and chemical products in the raffinaries in the Botlek. Mega carriers transport millions of containers from Asia with all kinds of products to the European market. The infrastructure around the Eemhaven and Waalhaven guarantee a quick transport to Europe.

Harbour Tycoon
This harbour game gives you the opportunity to be an entrepreneur transporting goods from all parts of the world with ships to the main port Rotterdam. The goods are processed in the different harbours to real products. But it can be quite busy in the harbour! Will you succeed in leading your ships to the right harbours and deliver products like bread, jam, gasoline and clothing to the European market in time? Maybe you will be the new Harbour Tycoon of Rotterdam!

Family game and expansion
The board game Rotterdam is easy to understand, but has an exciting game play with all the dynamics of the harbour in it. It can be played from 8 years and up. The players will enjoy the basic elements of the harbour: loading cargo, navigating your ships, transfer goods in the harbours and process the goods to products for the European market. Masters of Trade is the expansion to Rotterdam, which brings the economy to the game, introducing factories, more control and new markets.

Expanded by Masters of Trade
27789.name: Rotterdam

27790.name: De Ontembare Stad: Het Verraad
27790.description:
Het Verraad (Treason) is the first expansion to the game De Ontembare Stad (The Indomitable Citadel)

The tactical and strategic alternatives of Treason have grown significantly in comparison to the original "De Ontembare Stad". Luck is just a small factor in the game. The character of the Dark Master is an important new feature in the game, in fact introducing an extra player in the game. Each player becomes a chance to support the dark side or the good side. Investing in dark power increases the attractiveness of the Dark Master. New playing pieces as Watchtowers allow players to defend themselves against the attacks of the Dark Master. Giving money to the church improves the power of the good forces and gives some protection against the Dark forces. New castle cards and income blocks are a valuable new asset to the game, because the players are able to monitor their income in each category.

As the Citadel is prosperous and the number of citizens grows, rumor has it that a dark character will come inside the Citadel's walls. The Dark Master must be countered by the five Grand Masters to save The Citadel from destruction. But which of the Grand Masters are strong enough to withstand the attraction of the dark side. Since each one of them would like to increase their influence in the Citadel, one or more traitors are more likely to reveal their real character when the game draws to a thrilling finale.

27791.name: The Game of Society
27791.description: A pretty complicated game considering it was produced in 1874. The Game of Society is written on 55 cards (22 red (virtues), 13 black (vices) and 20 green (neutral) in 4 letters A B C D which stand for Angles, Britons, Celts and Danes the principle components of the Anglo-Saxon race. 2,4, or 6 can play. If played in teams the teams are either 2 or 3 person teams. Deal 7 cards to each player. The top card, called the Providence is then turned over. This determines trumps for that round. if the trump does not suit the person to the left of the dealer that person may say "NOLO" in which case two more cards are dealt to each player and a second Providence card is turned over which must remain trumps for the round, if the card does suit the player he calls "VOLO" and the hand begins. The cards have names on them that relate to their rank in the suit. Names like Benevolence, Christian, Industry, Press, Villain, Education, Intemperance, Virtues, Man in Home, Woman in home, Debt etc. These cards have value which determines which card wins the trick. Some cards reduce the value of a trick and therefore wind up resulting in a negative valued trick. Virtue cards are positive and vice cards are negatively valued, neutrals are just that and are worth zero. Object is to be the first to get to 7 points.

27792.name: Schley at Santiago Bay
27792.description:
From an article in "The Games We Played" by Margaret Hofer.

Schley at Santiago Bay is one of a series of patriotic games inspired by the Spanish-American War. 'Schley at Santiago Bay' celebrated war hero Winfield Scott Schley while teaching players facts about the recent war. Schley, hardly a household name today, was the U.S. Navy commodore in command of the Flying Squadron during the victorious battle at Santiago. An investigation conducted 2 years after the publication of the game found Schley guilty of negligence and misconduct during the battle.

27794.name: Operation Market Garden
27794.description: "Operation Market-Garden: Paratroops across the Rhine, September 1944" is the full title. Game features 400 colorful back printed die-cut counters and a beautiful four section interlocking, mounted, map board. Has two identical back printed player aid charts featuring terrain and combat resolution charts. One off board movement chart for the German player allows units to come on the map board. One glossy 35 page rule book (in Japanese). Best at two players though team play is fun too especially amongst the Allied player. Game features seven scenarios as well as the campaign game. From Hobby Japan Co., Ltd. No. 103 is the stock number.

27795.name: Pillow-Dex
27795.description:
From an paragraph in Margaret Hofer's book "The games we played"

"In Pillow Dex, a precursor of "Table Tennis" players volley a balloon over a net stretched across a parlor table. The idea being to keep the balloon from landing on your side of the table. If you can make it land on your opponents side 10 times you win the game. Pillow Dex was one of the most heavily advertised games of the period."

27796.description:
Nine Inning Classic is a baseball board game using dice, player cards and charts to determine the results of every play.

Players will pitch, hit, field and run as they did in real life. You make all the strategy calls. Make the line ups, decide when to pinch hit, steal, bunt, hit and run, bring the infield in to cut down the runner at home, and more.

Nine Inning Classic plays fast and has the feel and excitement of real baseball!

With Nine Inning Classic, you can play with any player that ever played baseball. With other games, you need to buy the teams you want to play with, but with Nine Inning Classic, you can make your own player cards. Just enter the player statistics on your computer and the cards are created almost automatically.

Special Features of Nine Inning Classic

You can make your own player cards.



On-line user group where you can get free user-made cards, get game enhancements, and chat about the game.



Unique, optional strategy cards you can play during the game, adding real fun and gamesmanship.



Lots of rare plays such as bad calls, hit batters and much more.
27796.name: Nine Inning Classic

27797.name: Bare It All
27797.description: A more risque adult party game where the player's witty answers on statement cards drive the fun.

27798.name: Oh God, You're Getting Married
27798.description: A party game meant to enliven any adult get-together as participants inject humor into answers on statement cards. Chicago Tribune Honorable Mention.

27799.name: Bottoms Up
27799.description:
How freaky are your friends?
What tacky talents do they possess?
Can they work as a team to meet any cheeky challenge?
Find out this and more with this hilarious adult party game
Includes instructions for non-drinking play


The teams take turns rolling the die and moving the appropriate number of spaces. Team members must take turns rolling on behalf of the team. The challenge categories are Truth or Bare, Perverted Pictures, Sexy Charades and Dirty Tricks. If a team lands on Bottoms Up!, everyone has to down their entire drink. The team may then roll again and continue their turn. Remember, everyone will have a good time if everyone remains safe. Please drink responsibly. There are non-drinking instructions as well. The game contents include everything you need to play except the beverages. Let’s toast to Bottoms Up! Bottoms Up Party Board Game is manufactured by Topco Sales under a license from Hustler Product.

27800.description:
Description from BoardgameNews.com:

Der Markt von Alturien is a family game for 2-6 players from 10 years old, in which luck and tactics stand in a well-balanced ratio.

In the medieval marketplace of Alturien, up to six competing trade families find themselves in an inexorable fight for influence and power.

In the ware market, seven different well-heeled customers have power over the prosperity and poverty of the traders. Which of the seven will visit your trade house is up to you and your trader opponents. With the revenues you earn, you can open new trade houses or enlarge an existing trade house by building a second, third or fourth floor—all with the goal of earning yet more revenue. Pay attention, though, for one customer might visit in the safety of twilight to steal and send you into poverty. All the talk is of the dark shape, the king of the thieves, the avenger of the suppressed: Gustavo the weasel! The trader who first creates for himself great wealth and acquires three status symbols will control the market and win.

This is an improved version of the old Wolfgang Kramer game City and is the first game in the Alturien series
27800.name: The Market of Alturien

27801.name: Happy Feet: Return to Emperor Land
27801.description: It’s a race through Antarctica as Mumble and his friends set off on a mission to save Emperor Land and find out what happened to all the fish. Starting out as eggs, Mumble, Gloria, Lovelace and Ramon hatch into penguins and begin their journey. Help them travel to Adelie Land, Blizzard Country and the Zoo by taking risky shortcuts or choosing safer routes. The first penguin to return saves Emperor Land and wins the game! Game includes a game board, 4 egg play pieces, 4 penguin play pieces: Mumble, Gloria, Lovelace and Ramon, dice, 35 Accidentally Cool cards, and instructions. Ages 5+

boardgamehonor: 2007 Fairplay À la carte Winner
27802.description:
Anno 1701: Das Kartenspiel is a cardgame by Klaus Teuber. Based on the principles of the Settlers of Catan Cardgame and the Anno 1701 computer game players are pioneers trying to develop their island as best as possible - starting out with only 2 houses. Victory points are won for controlling settlers and citizens.

Released: April 2007

This game is part of the Kosmos_two-player_series
27802.name: Anno 1701: Das Kartenspiel

27803.name: Aerodrome II
27803.description:
Aerodrome II is a miniatures game of aerial combat during World War II. Players take roles as pilots in fighters and bombers. Each player controls a 1/100 or 1/144 airplane mounted on antennas allowing planes to be at differing altitudes. The planes move over hexes on a table dueling with other players to shoot each other down.

As with Aerodrome, pilots pilot three moves at a time. There are many more maneuvers that these planes can do as compared to the World War I version. Movements occur simultaneously and pilots may fire on any plane down the hex row that his plane is pointing. Firepower differences between aircraft are simulated by rolling different sided die for determining hits.

27804.name: Lanko
27804.description:
In this Polish game the players try to get into the middle of the board. Moving and capturing are like in checkers, however there are some interesting twists: Players can move over their own stone to built a defense more carefully. In the middle of the Board there is an area where the same stones can be played by both partners to create momentum. And the objective is not necessary to eliminate the opponent, but the game can also be won by reaching certain spots on the board.

Home Page: http://lanko.com.pl/
Home Page (at publisher): http://www.bambusspiele.de/spiele/lanko/e_lanko_fr.htm

27805.name: 7 Answers of Highly Horny People
27805.description: "What’s on your mind? Compare answers in this 'guess what they’re thinking' poll of 7 horny people. Your imagination is the limit! Includes 52 game cards, 8 pads, 8 pencils, timer and rule sheet."

27806.name: OOOOOH!
27806.description: "The orgasmic game for couples! Contains 1 six-sided 'mood' die, 144 color-coded orgasmic encounter cards, 1 climax reward card, 25 blank climax reward sheets, 2 pencils, 2 concealment envelopes, 1 O-R-G-A-S-M-I-C score keeper, 1 scarf, and 1 feather."

27807.name: Booze, Boobs and Boners
27807.description: "The adult trivia game with an 'all or nothing' payoff! Most likely a naked one! Includes 52 game cards, 8 score pads, 8 pencils, 200 game chips, reference cards, card holder and rule sheet."

27808.name: Choose or Lose
27808.description: "'Touch n’ Feel, Kiss, Get Naked!' Always good advice. This daring stripping game will make any party memorable! Includes 3 dice, rule sheet and a storage tin."

27809.name: Get Your Rocks Off
27809.description: "Sexy moves and seductive strategies! Travel a rocky path and act, draw or interact sexually with another player! Includes game board, rule sheet, 2 dice, 24 playing pieces, pencil and pad."

27810.name: Sex Connects
27810.description: "'Horny minds think alike!' Do they? Are your thoughts as horny as your partner’s? This lusty word association game lets you find out. Includes 52 game cards, 8 writing pads, 8 pencils, 2 dice, electronic timer and rule sheet."

27811.name: Talk Dirty to Me, Lover
27811.description:
From the box:

Talk Dirty To Me, Lover is the original adult "party-down" dirty dice game. Players or teams compete for points using word dice to form complete sentences. Extra points are givene for dice that are shared in a crossword fashion or for sentences of 5 words or more. A huge selection of words lets any player talk as "sexy" or "dirty" as they please. And if your mouth gets you in trouble, blame it on the dice! A great go-anywhere party game.

Contents:

Forty-two (42) Six-Sided Word Dice
1 Two-Minute Sand Timer
1 Rule Booklet

27812.name: Kampen om svampen!
27812.description: Get the most mushrooms by betting, using cards and having luck with the dice.

27813.description: Patent pending strategy game for 2 players. Game is played on a grid of 62 dice (the dice matrix) that is randomized before each game, meaning that the board has a different layout every time you play (number of possible boards = 6^62 divided by 4 (symmetries)). Navigate the dice matrix creating dice islands, whilst tied to your opponent. Object of the game is to block or strand your opponent so that they cannot move.
27813.name: Saikoro

27814.name: Solomon's Stones
27814.description:
Solomon's Stones is a head to head strategy game that is so simple even young children can learn to play. Nonetheless, the number of permutations allows for quite complex strategies, so it is just as much fun for the serious game player. Designed as a coffee table show piece, with the stones being natural hematite gemstones, and with instructions printed onto a glossy A5 card.
The object of the game is to force your opponent to take the last of 28 stones. Players take turns to remove stones from any (but only one) of the rows or columns - all of which cross over each other, until there is only one stone left.

27815.name: Decade
27815.description:
From the back of the box:

The aim of the game is to pit your wits against your opponents on the way to being the first to collect a full "decade" of the biggest news stories from the past 40 years.

On the surface, Decade is a feel good game that allows all its players to share in their mutual history. But be warned. There'll be both good news and bad news along the way - making it a game which can both unite and divide its players.

Victory may be only one news story away, but a simple act of sabotage from a cunning opponent can throw the game wide open. Tempers can flair. Being bad can be beautiful. And victory is sweet indeed!

Decade defines the times - the legends, catastrophes, joys, victories, winners and losers. Because of this, it's a game which generations will enjoy for decades.

27816.name: The Young Talent Time Game
27816.description:
This is a board game based on the highly successful Australian TV series Young Talent Time which included young stars like Kylie & Dannii Minogue and all the rest of the Young Talent Time Team.

The object of the game is to make your way around the board by obeying the instructions on the cassette tape. The end of the game is when the first player scores 100 points or the 'Game Over' card is revealed.

The credits are as follows: Created and designed by Darryl Cotton and Nir Pizmony. Design & artwork is by Ian Costello. Photography by George Vernon. Tape was recorded at Emerald Hills Studios, South Melbourne. Additional Music by D. Cotton and C. Lim.

boardgamehonor: 2007 Charles S. Roberts Best Pre-World War II Boardgame Nominee
27817.description:
Marne 1918 - Friedensturm recreates the last large German offensive from May to August 1918, the turning point when the resumption of mobile warfare put an end to nearly four years of war of trench stalemate.

The game covers two months of fighting on the Marne, from the German offensive on May 27th through to the allied counter-offensive at the end of July. Scale for map is 3km/hex while units are divisions and regiments (for elite units).

3 scenario depict each German offensive and a campaign scenario covers the whole battle

Game components : 2 sheets of die-cut counters, 1 map (84*60cm), a basic rules booklet (24 pages), an advanced rulebook, with the game designer's notes and historical commentary (32 pages), two basic rules player aid cards, one victory point track,2 tracks for units management, 2 sheets for random events, 4 dice and a box.
27817.name: Marne 1918: Friedensturm

27818.name: Can-do Roo
27818.description: In Can-Do Roo, players reach into the kangaroo’s pouch and pull out a Fun Card that will tell them to hop to a particular shape or color. Or they might have to act and sound like a dog, frog, cow or other common animal. The 96 Fun Cards in Roo’s pouch also include letters of the alphabet to help children recognize each letter and learn what words start with that letter. If they pick a number card, they will have fun hopping that number of times while counting. Players who successfully complete their Fun Card keep the card, and the player who collects the most Fun Cards wins the game.

27819.name: Activator
27819.description:
Activator is an abstract strategy game designed for a piecepack and piecepack pyramids. It is played on a 4×4 board, and has a few other aspects in common with Plateau.

Players' pieces and stacks move according to the number of pieces in the stack: A single piece moves one space orthogonally; a double, up to two orthogonally; a triple, up to three orthogonally or diagonally. Moves may only be through empty spaces. Pieces and stacks may merge or split as part of their move. Each player also has one activator, that rides parasitically on the opponent's pieces. It moves up to four spaces orthogonally, from one opposing piece to another, and it is not considered a piece.

A player's activator empowers her pieces/stacks in the same rank or file to capture opposing an opposing piece/stack when they move. Additionally, any pieces/stacks in the two spaces where the activation lines of the players' activators cross are immobilized.

You can win the game one of two ways:


Occupy your opponent's home space with one of your pieces/stacks for an entire round.
Reduce your opponent's forces to one piece/stack to win immediately.

27820.name: Army Brats
27820.description:
Army Brats is a game to be played with a standard piecepack. The players are in military school, and are trying to get kicked out for excessively poor attendance. Players can work on getting demerits by getting caught having enough forged absentee passes to skip half or more of a school day (pair through four-of-a-kind), or to dodge homework by missing three or more days in a row of the same class (runs of three or more).

Players acquire these forged passes by moving to an adjacent classroom of the desired subject, and then either dealing with the non-player student in that room, or forcing a trade with another player. The types of trades you can make depend on the sort of pass you have for your current classroom.

Once a player gets herself "caught" with a demerit-worthy set of passes, she receives more demerits for a strongly incriminating set of passes.

The first player to 20 demerits wins, and is free from the hard military life!

boardgamehonor: 2007 Charles S. Roberts Best DTP-Produced Boardgame Nominee
27821.description:
From the designer:

"Blackshirt, The Italian Invasion of Egypt, 1940, is a game covering Italy’s invasion of Egypt, before Rommel came to rescue them from their folly. This game uses an updated, and slightly expanded, version of the Bitter Victory game system: no CRT, buckets o’ dice, and cards...a totally new approach to gaming battles that can be learned in five minutes and played in 2-3 hours.

Most of the rules and mechanics will be familiar to anyone who has ever played a wargame. BSO Games, however, has added to this simplicity a combat system that rates units for how many dice they get to roll on their behalf, as well as what kind of dice (small arms or Heavy Weapons). No CRTs, no siree!
